questions.text: Who directed "Clue"?
questions.explanation:
Jonathan Lynn.

	Jonathan Lynn also co-wrote "Clue" with John Landis.

questions.text: What was the name of the house where the dinner party was held?
questions.explanation:
Hill House.

	"Hill House off Route 41."

questions.text: What year was "Clue" released in North America?
Yvette was really an American.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Just before she was murdered she was whispering to her killer in an American accent.  However, she did speak during the rest of the film using a French accent.

questions.text: If you caught all of the endings, what color was Mrs. Peacock's car?
questions.explanation:
Blue.

	It can be seen with the ending where she killed them all.

questions.text: What year was the film set in?
questions.explanation:
1954.

	New England in 1954 to be exact.

questions.text: When Wadsworth is recounting the events of the evening in the dining room, whose chair is missing from the table?
questions.explanation:
Professor Plum.

	You can see that the chair has been set aside away from the table but is still in the shot.

questions.text: In which room is there NOT a murder committed?
questions.explanation:
Ballroom.

	The cook was killed with the knife in the kitchen.  The cop was killed with the lead pipe in the library.  Yvette was killed with the rope in the billiard room.

questions.text: Who came into money during the war when s/he lost his/her mommy and daddy?
questions.explanation:
Colonel Mustard.

	This was of course a lie because it is later revealed by Colonel Mustard that the shock of his scandalous behavior would have killed his mother.

questions.text: What was Miss Scarlett's response when Colonel Mustard asked her if she liked Kipling?
questions.explanation:
Sure, I'll eat anything.

	She is of course confused thinking that Colonel Mustard is referring to the plate of appetizers that he is handing her versus her opinion of Kipling the writer.

questions.text: What was the phone number on the telephone used by the motorist?
questions.explanation:
YL 7091.

	This number can be seen when the murderer hangs up the phone.

questions.text: When the cop is trying to get out of the library he is yelling several things that he will arrest them for.  Which of the following is not one that he mentioned?
questions.explanation:
Larceny.

	"I just said that so you would open the door."

questions.text: Which pair searched the cellar?
questions.explanation: Mrs. Peacock and Professor Plum

questions.text: How many husbands had Mrs. White had?
questions.explanation:
5.

	"Mine or other women-----5, yes, just the 5."

questions.text: Who originally had the lead pipe?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Green

	"I didn't do it."  In the ending where each party guest killed someone Mr. Green shot Wadsworth, who was actually Mr. Boddy, with the gun in the Hall.

questions.text: While Wadsworth is revealing Mrs. Peacock's secret in the study, what is Mr. Boddy doing in the background?
questions.explanation:
cracking his knuckles.

	If you look closely while Wadsworth is talking to Mrs. Peacock you can see him cracking his fingers individually.

questions.text: What room was the tape recorder in?
questions.explanation:
Billiard Room.

	If you recall Yvette is sitting on the billiard table playing with the balls while Wadsworth is revealing everyone's secrets.

questions.text: What popular TV series of the 70s and 80s could the cook, Mrs. Ho, be seen on?
questions.explanation:
M*A*S*H.

	Kellye Nakahara played a nurse.

questions.text: What phrase does Mrs. Peacock use during dinner?
questions.explanation:
Heavens to Betsy.

	"Oh, heavens to Betsy, I don't know why."

questions.text: Tim Curry was nominated for a Best Supporting Actor Oscar for his portrayal of Wadsworth?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Unfortunately, none of the actors were nominated for their work on this film.
